instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/ <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting into os
threads.message:
hi, long time watcher first time paying, I have 2 boards one 3208 and a 3209, get most of the way into the os and power off,
3209, replaced <RESISTOR>R2822</RESISTOR> c 2820 <RESISTOR>R2821</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R2820</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R1010</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, i thought the ssd was faulty but plugged in my sierra ssd into it and ends with an X (same as 3208)
3208, no corrosion anywhere, came in for boot failure, internal ssd turns machine off, external turns to X
internet asd reports no issues
if louis sees this, sorry for adguard, hope this helps a bit

update, the problem wit both is the ssd, the 13 inch had a broken component on the end, im guessing a filter I replaced it with a jumper and it works in both laptops, the 11 inch ssd is a toshiba, i should have known

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/ <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting into os
threads.message: Prepare a bootable USB stick for testing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/ <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting into os
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 16220"]Prepare a bootable USB stick for testing.[/QUOTE]
my personal macbook didnt have an ssd so i used an external one, when I used that I got an X on both macbooks, I only have a sierra installation flash drive I dont have anything else, advice?
